title: Leonardo da Vinci, Musée du Louvre, review: in this scintillating, blockbuster show, Leonardo skewers the heart
text:
Three metal hooks on a bare grey wall: was this the spot designated for Leonardo da Vinci’s “Salvator Mundi”?

Amid the hoopla at Friday’s press view for the Louvre’s new blockbuster marking the 500th anniversary of the artist’s death, hopes were swiftly dashed that the world’s most expensive, and controversial, painting was about to be unveiled.

In came the art handlers, bearing a different painting by Leonardo: his late – and, for my taste, simpering and mannered – “Saint John the Baptist”.

Still, even without the “Salvator Mundi” – which sold at auction for $450 million two years ago, and, rumoured to be on Saudi Arabian crown prince Mohammed bin Salman’s superyacht, hasn’t been seen in...
